intro: Neoschimpera heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf neoschimpera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowers are small, often clustered, and can vary in color, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Neoschimpera heterophylla is valued in horticulture for its unique foliage and resilience in drought-prone regions.
